label.text: Vertical Farms
By 2050, the worldâ€™s population could increase to about 10 billion people. Scientists estimate that food production will have to increase by 30% to feed this population.
Currently, most food is grown outdoors on farms. However, this method is unlikely to meet the increasing demand for food.
Vertical farms may provide a solution to this challenge. In vertical farms, crops are grown in vertically stacked layers within closed buildings powered by solar panels.
Technology is used to control conditions so that:
water flows from top to bottom and is recycled
optimal light, nutrient and temperature levels are maintained.
